page.title: 15Religion
page.content: Although there are Churches of England in Newburn and Throckley,it is the Methodist influence which is the predominant persuasion in this area.In the past there have been both Methodist and Primitive Methodist Chapels in Lemington,Throckley, Walbottle and Newburn.Today we only find Methodist Chapels in Lemington, Walbottle and Throckley.With the closing of the Primitive Methodist Chapel in Walbottle and an expanding population,due to the increase of industry in the area,the original Chapel,built in 1837 was closed,and a new one built. In the past Catholics had to go to Bells Close for services.In 1935 a Catholic School was built,and later a Church in Throckley in 1975. Jehovah's Witnesses have recently moved into the old Coop buildings.
